definition:
Amputation is the removal of a limb by trauma,
medical illness, or surgery. As a surgical measure, it is used to control pain or a disease
process in the affected limb, such as malignancy or gangrene. In some cases, it is carried
out on individuals as a preventive surgery for such problems. [from Wikipedia] Note that
to distinguish this from a minor loss of part of a limb this must include loss of some &%Bone.
